body.p: Some respondents to the 2005 Exposure Draft said that co‑operatives do not fit within the definition of a mutual entity and that co‑operatives are sufficiently different from other entities to justify a different method of accounting for combinations involving only co‑operatives. To support their view, they cited factors such as differences in legal characteristics and different purposes of co‑operatives in addition to providing economic benefits to members.
